text:
AIX5.2 2.0.47 
problem: get a core dump after I try to start apache
./apachectl[67]: 36780 Trace/BPT trap(coredump)

command used to compile:
CPPFLAGS=-D_THREAD_SAFE CC=gcc ./configure --enable-so --enable-mods-shared=most
make
make install

Any advice would be apperciated. I also have to do the tomcat interface (mod_jk)
so advice on that is welcome also
creator: shawn.pate@lawson.com
shawn.pate@lawson.com
text:
Created attachment 16975
copy of the core file it has been compressed with winzip

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Please switch to 2.0.55.  If it still core dumps, get a backtrace on your
machine instead of attaching the coredump.  This should do it:

To analyse the core dump, pass the core dump filename on the gdb command-line,
and enter the command bt full at the gdb prompt:

  % gdb /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd /tmp/core.2027
  ...
  Core was generated by `/usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -k start'
  ...
  (gdb) bt full

Post the output.
